ESP.ORIGINAL: RobcOS v.85 (C)2076 Robco ======================== | User Log: | >> Administrator (RobcoID 2398-H) | >> Default Targeting_Param: | >>> VaultTec_userGroup ========================

We are out of here, you're not turning us into one of your experimental zombies. Did you actually think we would buy into that biological warfare shit? We will take our chances outside.
PS Thank the overseer for all of his survival gear
ESP.TRADUIT:
我们走了，你不能把我们变成你的实验僵尸。你真以为我们会信生物战的鬼话吗 ? 我们将在外面碰碰运气。
PS:感谢监督提供的所有生存装备

ESP.ORIGINAL:
Ground House Entrance
1. Down the Train Tunnel - couldn't find it before, maybe they cleared away some of the debris, they have had plenty of time
2. Transformer Station? There was a destroyed building above the tunnel entrance, maybe it was underneath that
3. The utility shaft in the train tunnel? I thought that was just ventilation
4. Maybe another entrance, the lake water was flowing somewhere, an underwater cave?
ESP.TRADUIT:
地上小屋入口
1. 沿着火车隧道往下走 - 之前找不到，也许他们已经清理了一些残骸，他们有足够的时间。
2. 变电站?隧道入口上面有一栋被毁的建筑，也许就在下面。
3.火车隧道里的综合竖井?我以为那只是通风口。
4. 也许是另一个入口，湖水在某处流淌，一个水下洞穴?

ESP.ORIGINAL: Trail Log 17 of 43: Dr Fent's Work Notes
ESP.TRADUIT: 追踪日志17/43：芬特医生的工作笔记

ESP.ORIGINAL:
One of the prisoners has offered some of his friends as part of a deal. I thought this was very good, so as I seem to keep losing things, I have decided to keep him in a box in case he comes up with another good deal.
As a gesture of goodwill I will also give his friend his arm back. Well, another arm as I eaten the first one. Fortunately I have plenty of spare parts.
Attaching an arm requires delicate micro surgery so I used my best blow torch, although the patient seemed to object. On considering his objections I agreed that we should go for the full upgrade complete with an extra arm and power steering and I also have a spare combustion engine. I think he agreed judging by the look on his face when I showed it to him. He simply asked where I was going to put it, so I told him.
The procedure did not start well as I couldn't find his gear box, despite having a good rummage around. After this I decided to give the patient a local anaesthetic. I knew that battery acid would come in useful.
I wonder if I can find any white wall tyres? That would really cheer him up.
ESP.TRADUIT:
其中一名囚犯提出用他的一些朋友作为交易的一部分。我觉得这很好，所以由于我似乎一直在丢失东西，我决定把他关在一个盒子里，以防他再想出另一个好交易。
作为一种善意的表示，我也会把他的手臂还给他的朋友。好吧，另一只手臂，因为我吃了一只。幸运的是，我有很多备用的。
接上一只手臂需要精细的显微手术，所以我用了我最好的喷灯，尽管病人似乎反对。考虑到他的反对意见，我同意我们应该进行全面升级，配备一个额外的手臂和动力转向系统，我也有一个备用的内燃机。我想他是同意的，从我给他看的时候他脸上的表情就能看出来。他只是问我要把它放在哪里，我就告诉了他。
手术开始时并不顺利，因为我找不到他的齿轮箱，尽管我翻了个遍。在这之后，我决定给病人局部麻醉。我知道电池酸液会有用的。
我想知道我能不能找到一些白壁轮胎?那会让他高兴起来的。

ESP.ORIGINAL: Tell Jerry he can store his precious robots in the cistern if he wants to. Just make sure no one shuts off the waterfall, cause with the high water that place will fill up in seconds and I don't think they are amphibious.
ESP.TRADUIT: 告诉杰瑞，如果他愿意，他可以把他的宝贝机器人放在蓄水池里。只要确保没有人关闭瀑布，因为水位很高，几秒钟内就会填满，而且我想它们应该不是两栖的。

ESP.ORIGINAL:
Don't worry about the robots.
I've locked out the sluice gate controls so they can't be operated accidentally and set the gates, outflow open, cistern closed. The only way the cistern can be flooded is if someone was to operate the emergency override valves so it was the other way around and what idiot would do that? I've locked the door anyway.
ESP.TRADUIT:
不要担心机器人。
我锁上了闸门控制装置，这样它们就不会被意外操作打开闸门，打开出口，关闭蓄水池。蓄水池进水的唯一方法是有人操作紧急超压阀，所以情况正好相反。哪个白痴会这么做?反正我把门锁上了。

ESP.ORIGINAL:
Business seems to be picking up. I use to just get a few raiders and the odd prospector, but recently I've had some NCR, quite a few Vipers and it looks like there is another group up at the diner.
I'll pick out a tasty looking one, I'm going to start to put on weight if I'm not careful!
I'll go at dawn to wait for this lot, I couldn't make them all out last night and I need to check they are not with Angel, but I did see a man and a women shooting up and they look like Raiders to me. Should be easy. I'll leave the oven on.
ESP.TRADUIT:
生意似乎在好转。我过去只得到一些掠夺者和奇怪的淘金客，但最近我有一些NCR，相当多的毒蛇帮，而且看起来在餐馆里还有另一伙人。
我会挑一个看起来很好吃的，如果我不小心的话，我就要开始发胖了!
我明天黎明就去等这群人，我昨晚没能把他们都赶出来，我得确认一下他们是不是和安琪儿在一起，但我确实看到一男一女在开枪，我看他们像掠夺者。应该很容易对付。我得把烤箱开着。

ESP.ORIGINAL: Need to cook up some more of my special meat pies. Angel should be coming past before long and I need to trade for some ammo. Evidently there is a raider crowd down the road who are quite partial to my cooking. Just as well some more ingredients have turned up.
ESP.TRADUIT: 我得再做些我特制的肉馅饼。安琪儿很快就会过来，我需要和她交换一些弹药。显然这条路上有一群掠夺者，他们很喜欢我做的菜，正好有更多的食材出现了。

ESP.ORIGINAL: V616 Security Chief Personal Log Entry 04
ESP.TRADUIT: 66号避难所安全主管个人日志04

ESP.ORIGINAL:
2101
We have a plan. We have a way out and have dug out information on some government facility called 'Ground House', which might just suit our needs.
ESP.TRADUIT:
2101
我们有了个计划。我们有一条出路，已经挖出了一些有关政府设施的信息，这些设施被称为“地上小屋”，可能正好符合我们的需要。
伯吉斯日记 1 - 似曾相识

ESP.ORIGINAL:
Never thought I would be back here again.
I've done some scouting for an NCR big cheese, they pay well for someone who gets results and can keep their mouths shut. But when they mentioned a VaultTec vault up in the mountains north of Vegas... it would have made my hair stand on end if I had any.
ESP.TRADUIT:
从没想过我还会回来。
我为NCR的大人物做了些调查，他们给能有成果又能守口如瓶的人付了很多钱。但当他们提到维加斯北部山区的一个避难所科技的避难所时......我的头发都会竖起来的，如果我有的话。
伯吉斯日记 2 - 维加斯研究

ESP.ORIGINAL:
I needed to bring my own knowledge up to date and I've got some information from a hobo in Westside. Most thought he was just another bum with a treasure map but I recognised some of the info as solid. He was quite forthcoming once I had slapped him around a bit.
I need to head back that way, gather more information, do some research. There is another loose end I would like to tie up as well.
ESP.TRADUIT: 我需要与时俱进，我从西区的一个流浪汉那里得到了一些信息。大多数人认为他只是一个拿着藏宝图的流浪汉，但我认为一些信息是可靠的。我打了他一巴掌，他就很乐意帮忙了。 0 我得回去，收集更多信息，做些调查。我还想解决另一个问题。
伯吉斯日记 4 - 地上小屋

ESP.ORIGINAL:
Ground House Access Code: SD45-889G-00IU-323X --------------------------------- Its been 6 years since I sent Bennet and his three stooges up to check on 'Ground House'. I know they got there as they sent a message back saying there was now a place called Rita's Cafe built on it. Then nothing. I would of known if they had returned, I would have picked them up in Vegas.
Fucking amateurs. I knew I shouldn't have given them the access codes.
ESP.TRADUIT:
地上小屋访问代码：
SD45-889G-00IU-323X -------------------------------- 6年前，我派本内特和他的三个跟班上去检查“地上小屋”。我知道他们到了那里，因为他们发回消息说现在有一个叫丽塔咖啡馆的地方建在那里，然后就没有了。如果他们回来了，我会知道的，我会在维加斯把他们接走。
该死的外行人，我就知道不该把密码给他们。
伯吉斯日记 3 - 发薪日

ESP.ORIGINAL:
I've passed on what I've acquired to some NCR drone called Kelly. His merry band are off to make their fortune and have no idea what is waiting for them. Not sure myself to be honest.
I'm really tempted to go and watch how this all pans out as it would be quite entertaining, but I need to keep my distance. I'll pick up the pieces later when they have all knocked themselves out.
ESP.TRADUIT:
我把我得到的东西给了一个叫凯利的NCR小蜜蜂。他那伙人快乐的离开去赚钱了，不知道等待他们的是什么。我实话，我自己也不确定。
我真的很想去看看结果会怎样因为这会很有趣，但我需要保持距离。等他们都筋疲力尽了，我再收拾残局。

ESP.ORIGINAL:
Bennet
Listen you idiot, check out the local area and find out if anyone ever managed to find or access this 'Ground House'. I've told you where its likely to be if it does exist.
I know this is difficult for you but try and be discreet. If its still a possibility let me know, I'll deal with it personally. DO NOT GO IN.
Burgess
ESP.TRADUIT:
本内特
听着，你这个白痴，看看附近有没有人找到或进入过这个“地上小屋”。如果它确实存在，我已经告诉过你它可能在哪里。
我知道这对你来说很难，但尽量小心点。如果还有可能，请告诉我，我会亲自处理。不要进去。
- 伯吉斯

ESP.ORIGINAL:
2081
We have been sealed in for a while now and its all pretty calm. We have heard nothing from the outside at all, not even any explosions. I guess the vault was built well. No communications at all though.
The experiments have been delayed, still some more background research to be done evidently. Dr Nice, our resident chief scientist, is organising the details. He keeps to himself, a very driven man. A geneticist and one of the team involved in finding a cure for the new plague I understand. Specialising in something called the Pan-Immunity Virion, whatever that is.
ESP.TRADUIT:
2081
我们被封在里面已经有一段时间了，一切都很平静。我们根本没有从外面听到任何声音，甚至没有任何爆炸声。我猜避难所建得很好，不过没有任何通讯。
实验被推迟了，显然还有更多的背景研究要做。我们的常驻首席科学家尼斯博士正在组织细节。他独来独往，干劲十足。一位遗传学家，也是我所了解的新瘟疫治疗小组的成员之一。专门研究泛免疫病毒粒子，不管那是什么。

ESP.ORIGINAL:
2088
The experiments have been going well, we have had some extremely good results but also some rather disturbing side effects. Skin problems, sensitivity to light and more. Some of the subjects are also demonstrating some strange behavioral patterns as well. Some quite disturbing, we have had to restrain one.
Dr Nice seems to have it covered though, he has been treating them with some sort of blood product. Animal blood doesn't do it, has to be human but then isn't that what the control group is for? We just give them the biological warfare and faulty filters story to keep them on side.
ESP.TRADUIT:
2088
实验进行得很顺利，我们得到了一些非常好的结果，但也有一些相当令人不安的副作用。皮肤问题，对光敏感等等。一些实验对象也表现出一些奇怪的行为模式。有些挺烦人的，我们只好克制一下。
尼斯医生似乎已经解决了这个问题，他一直在用某种血液制品治疗他们。动物的血液不能做到这一点，必须是人类的，但这不正是对照组的目的吗？我们只是给他们讲生化战争和过滤器有问题的故事，让他们站在一边。

ESP.ORIGINAL:
2102
I authorised a patrol to go outside and check for the missing members, but not to go too far. They didn't find them, not that I was really expecting them to.
On the plus side they did pull in a couple of other locals. Sorry looking pair, didn't get much useful information out of them but plenty of blood. That will help.
ESP.TRADUIT:
2102
我授权一支巡逻队到外面去寻找失踪的成员，但不能走太远。他们没有找到他们，但我并不指望他们会找到。
从好的方面看，他们确实拉来了其他几个当地人。看起来很遗憾，没有从他们那里得到多少有用的信息，但有很多血。这将有所帮助。

ESP.ORIGINAL:
2104
Things have been getting pretty bad around here. Some of the local 'livestock' we have been pulling in are keen drug users and this is causing Dr Nice all sorts of problems. We have started to keep them in pens to 'dry' out but this takes time and not all survive.
What's more I have found out that some personnel have been actually eating them as well. What the hell is going on? There is no food shortage. Dr Nice, surprisingly, wasn't at all shocked by this, just rambled on about side effects and hormones, but I know I didn't damn well authorise it. And what did he mean about 'known' side effects?
I'll talk to the new chief of security, for what it's worth. I found out a while ago that he was brought here by the Doctor and in all likelihood is his man. What a mess, I really need to sort these people out and re-assert my authority. This current state of affairs will not do.
ESP.TRADUIT:
2104
这里的情况越来越糟了。我们引进的一些当地“牲畜”是瘾君子，这给尼斯医生带来了各种问题。我们已经开始把它们关在围栏里“晾晒”，但这需要时间，而且不是所有的都能存活下来。
更重要的是，我发现有些人实际上也在吃它们。到底怎么回事?不存在食物短缺。令人惊讶的是，尼斯医生对此一点也不震惊，只是漫无目的地谈论副作用和激素，但我知道我并没有授权。他说的“已知”副作用是什么意思?
我会和新的安全主管谈谈，不管怎样。我不久前发现，他是博士带来的，很可能是他的手下。是真一团糟，我真的需要把这些人整理出来，重新维护我的权威。目前的情况是不行的。
66号避难所安全主管个人日志01

ESP.ORIGINAL:
2096
I need to be careful what I write on the security office terminal, I know the Overseer can access it if he really wants too as well as personal terminals.
No body comes up to this level much any more and as security its my job to check this area. I can work here.
ESP.TRADUIT:
2096
我需要小心我在安全办公室终端上写的东西，我知道监督可以访问它，如果他真的想要的话，包括个人终端。
现在已经没有人再到这一层来了，作为安全人员，我的工作就是检查这个区域。我可以在这里工作。

ESP.ORIGINAL: V616 Security Chief Personal Log Entry 02
ESP.TRADUIT: 66号避难所安全主管个人日志02

ESP.ORIGINAL: V616 Security Chief Personal Log Entry 03
ESP.TRADUIT: 66号避难所安全主管个人日志03

ESP.ORIGINAL:
2098
Well, I wanted to find out what was going on and I have. What do they say? Be careful what you wish for.
I finally got to the Overseer's terminal and I read it over and over but still couldn't believe it. We are nothing more than fucking lab rats. How the hell did they ever think they could get away with it? But then they have haven't they?
I need to concentrate on what do next, what I can do something about, not what I should do, which is to kill these VaultTec drones. I have to focus.
I can't trust most of my security team as they are all VaultTec. I'm the odd one, last minute replacement drafted in from the Army. Need to work out who I can trust then get us out of here. Need to get people to trust me, Jesus, I was part of this.
This will not look good on the resume.
ESP.TRADUIT:
2098
好吧，我想我已经知道发生了什么事。他们是怎么说的？小心你所希望的东西。
我终于进入了监督的终端，一遍又一遍地读着它，但还是无法相信，我们不过是该死的小白鼠。他们怎么会认为他们可以逃脱呢？但他们已经做到了，不是吗？
我需要专注于下一步该做什么，我能做什么，而不是我应该做什么，也就是杀死这些避难所科技无人机。我必须集中精力。
我不能信任我的安保团队，因为他们都属于避难所科技。我是个奇怪的人，临时从军队招来的替补。得先找出我能信任的人然后我们才能离开这里。得让人们相信我，天啊，我也参与了。
这在简历上不会好看。

ESP.ORIGINAL:
We are running a bit short on ammo again so I'll have to send someone over to fucking Blu Ray to trade for some more. I would love to take that bastard down but he's the only place we can get ammo from. Even Angel gets most of her stock there. Anyway, that house is a fucking bunker.
Maybe we should wait for Angel anyway, she'll put a mark up on stuff, but every time I send one of these Muppets over there, they go sniffing around and end up getting killed.
Talking of Angel, I wonder where she gets her pies from? Sure taste good.
ESP.TRADUIT:
我们的弹药又快不够了，所以我得派人去找该死的蓝光换一些。我很想扳倒那个混蛋，但他是我们唯一能弄到弹药的地方，就连安琪儿的大部分库存都是在那里买的。总之，那房子就是个该死的地堡。
也许我们应该等安琪儿，她会在东西上做标记，但每次我把这些木偶送到那里，它们就会四处嗅探，最后被杀。
说到安琪儿，我想知道她的派是从哪里来的?当然味道不错。

ESP.ORIGINAL:
My first real attempt at recreating Vera.
By chance I noted that one of the raider characters at the bridge bore a significant resemblance. It was at this point I first considered the possibility of bringing Vera back to life, in a manner of speaking, so I attempted to isolate the individual in question and recover her back to my lab for further tests.
The initial phase was successful with the application of the correct medication, which she was surprisingly happy to self administer. However once the medication started to wear off the subject became quite uncooperative and aggressive and I was forced to kill her, which is something of a setback. Never the less, I kept her in stasis in hope of still taking the project forward.
Supplemental Note:
It seems my stasis pod is not functioning at optimum efficiency and this oversight has probably put paid to this project phase. Undaunted I shall move forward with phase 2 and a new approach.
ESP.TRADUIT:
我第一次真正尝试重塑维拉。
一个偶然的机会，我注意到在桥上的一个掠夺者的角色有显著的相似之处。在这一点上，我第一次考虑让维拉复活的可能性，从某种意义上说，所以我试图隔离这个人，把她带回我的实验室做进一步的测试。
由于正确的药物应用，最初阶段取得了成功，她很高兴自己能得到药物。然而，一旦药效开始减弱，这个人变得非常不合作和有攻击性，我被迫杀了她，这是一种挫折。尽管如此，我还是不能让她停滞不前，希望继续推进这个项目。
补充说明:
看来我的静止舱没有以最佳效率运行这个疏忽可能已经让这个项目付出了代价。我将毫不气馁地推进第二阶段和新的方法。

ESP.ORIGINAL:
I have managed to obtain some research material and hardware from the actual Sierra Madre thanks to my source in Hayford, although the price has been considerable. This may actually realise a recreation of Vera in holographic format which should be far easier to manage in terms that I will not have to shoot her to ensure her cooperation.
I have made good progress but there are still the following serious problems to be overcome.
Issue 1: The obtained, but non-functional holographic projector is the size of a small cooking pot whereas my device would not fit in a kitchen. I need to source smaller components.
Issue 2: The obtained holographic projector allowed the holograms to move around and, to a degree, interact with their surroundings. My hologram just stands there saying and doing very little and is restricted within the projector. And to be honest she is a bit blotchy as well. This is dreadfully disappointing.
ESP.TRADUIT:
由于我在海福德的线人，我设法从马德雷山脉获得了一些研究材料和硬件，尽管价格相当高。这可能实际上实现了维拉的全息再现，这应该更容易管理，因为我将不必开枪打死她，以确保她的合作。
我已经取得了很大的进步，但仍有以下几个严重的问题需要克服。
问题1:获得的非功能性全息投影仪只有一个小锅那么大，而我的设备在厨房里放不下。我需要采购更小的组件。
问题2:获得的全息投影仪允许全息图四处移动，并在一定程度上与周围环境相互作用。我的全息图只是站在那里说和做的很少，被限制在投影仪。说实话，她也有点脏。这是非常令人失望的。

ESP.ORIGINAL:
A chance encounter in Hayford gave rise to an unplanned resurrection of the Vera 1 project.
Again this project has proven to be problematic as the subject is once more uncooperative, despite an initial assessment that promised otherwise.
This time however I shall be more patient and move things forward at a slower pace. To be more organised I have separated difficulties in a separate entries.
ESP.TRADUIT:
在海福德的一次偶遇意外地让维拉1号项目复活了。
这个项目再次被证明是有问题的，因为主题再次不合作，尽管最初的评估承诺相反。
然而，这一次我将更有耐心，以较慢的速度推进事情。为了更有条理，我将困难分开记入单独的条目中。

ESP.ORIGINAL:
Issue 1: She doesn't behave like Vera
Subject behavioural analysis has revealed very few Vera like attributes overall. I have attributed this down to lack of cooperation but have made some progress In the area from the subject by administering the following items:
A. Chems. This generally works quite well although the subject generally starts behaving much the same as subject 2 and in effect ceases to function.
B. Alcohol. Can sometimes have the desired effect but can be unpredictable.
C. Caps. This by far produces the best results but after the acquisition of the products from the Sierra Madre I have very little left.
ESP.TRADUIT:
问题1:她不像维拉
对象行为分析显示总体上很少有类似维拉的属性。 我将此归因于缺乏合作，但通过管理以下项目在该主题领域取得了一些进展：
A.化学。这通常工作得很好，尽管主体通常开始表现得和主体2差不多，实际上停止了功能。
b.酒精。有时可以达到预期的效果，但也可能无法预测。
c.瓶盖。到目前为止，这产生了最好的结果，但在收购了马德雷山脉的产品后，我剩下的就很少了。

ESP.ORIGINAL:
Issue 2: She doesn't look like Vera
Solution: dress & wig. Cannot be considered a permanent solution although it seems to work reasonably well as long as I keep at least 30m away from her.
ESP.TRADUIT:
问题2:她看起来不像维拉
解决方法:穿着和戴假发。不能被认为是一个永久的解决方案，尽管它似乎是合理的工作，只要我保持她至少30米的距离。

ESP.ORIGINAL:
Issue 3: She doesn't talk like Vera
She does not have the same voice as Vera and since becoming sober has expressed a number of opinions on myself and my research. I am sure that Vera Keyes would not have made the declaration that I 'blow goats'. However, I do have to admit, I don't understand what this statement actually means, although it does not sound positive. A temporary solutions is the same as issue 2 except to increase the distance to 50m as she can shout quite loudly.
ESP.TRADUIT:
问题3:她说话不像维拉
她的声音和维拉不一样，自从她戒了酒之后，她就对我自己和我的研究发表了一些看法。我相信维拉·凯斯不会宣布我是“吹山羊”。然而，我不得不承认，我不明白这句话实际上是什么意思，尽管它听起来并不积极。临时解决办法和第2个问题一样，只是把距离增加到50米，因为她可以大声喊。

ESP.ORIGINAL:
Issue 4: She doesn't smell like Vera
I'm sure the original Vera did not smell like a Brahmin although I cannot confirm this as I can find no information on Vera Keyes's aroma, data on this specific area is frustratingly limited.
The subject herself suggested a solution in the form of a bath but I am loathed to take advice from someone without a scientific background. A temporary solution is the same as issue 2.
ESP.TRADUIT:
问题4:她闻起来不像薇拉
我确信原始的维拉闻起来不像婆罗门，尽管我不能确认这一点，因为我找不到维拉·凯斯的香味信息，这一特定区域的数据令人沮丧地有限。
她自己提出了一个洗澡的解决方案，但我不愿听取没有科学背景的人的建议。临时解决方案与第2个问题相同。

ESP.ORIGINAL:
Issue 5: Her name isn't Vera
I should have paid more attention when she approached me in Hayford. She was already under the influence of alcohol and when I asked her name she stated that she was whoever I wanted her to be. When she then gave her name as Vera I should have recognised that this information was of dubious authenticity.
ESP.TRADUIT:
问题5:她的名字不是维拉
她在海福德找我的时候，我应该多留心的。她已经在酒精的影响下了，当我问她的名字时，她说她就是我想让她成为的人。当她告诉我她叫维拉时，我应该意识到这个消息的真实性是可疑的。

ESP.ORIGINAL:
======================== | User Log: | >> Administrator (RobcoID 2621-K) ========================
> All Systems Operational > Access Lockdown in Force > Turret Systems Activated > Robot Defence Units Activated > Lethal Force Authorised > Have a Nice Day :) >/
ESP.TRADUIT:
======================== |用户日志: | >>管理员(RobcoID 2621-K) ========================
所有系统正常运行
>进入封锁状态
炮塔系统启动
>机器人防御单位启动
>致命武力授权
>祝你有愉快的一天:)
>/

ESP.ORIGINAL:
Storage Database is now offline.
- Stores are now closed to all personnel - Existing Stock to be catalogued and back loaded - All Items now required are to be requested via external sources - All requests are to be authorised by senior management - Management are not to authorise any request without approval - Approvals are to endorsed prior to request
Supplemental Note:
>> >> Hey, you tight fisted asshole! I see its business as usual then.. >>
ESP.TRADUIT:
存储数据库现在脱机。
- 商店现在对所有人员关闭
- 对现有库存进行分类并重新装载
- 所有物品现在需要通过外部来源请求
- 所有申请均须经高级管理层批准
- 管理层不得批准任何未经批准的请求
- 批准须在请求前签署
补充说明:
>> >>嘿，你这个吝啬的混蛋！ 我看到它照常营业... >>

ESP.ORIGINAL:
The place is called Lillypad field. You reach it via a cave that goes up behind the waterfall, the entrance is behind Greta's bus, it's marked on your gadget and I've given you the key.
I reckon 20 raiders/walking plants or whatever you want to call them and 10 of those spitting plants. They may be awkward to find, but they shouldn't have any problems finding you. If you get stuck just run around, you'll see them. Kill them all then come and see me.
There is a old hunting shack down the south end of the field. The key is in a pot by one of the doors. As a gesture of good faith you can use it and help yourself to whatever is in there.
Blinder
ESP.TRADUIT:
这个地方叫睡莲叶田，你可以通过瀑布后面的一个洞穴到达，入口就在格蕾塔的巴士后面，你的小装置上有标记，我已经给了你钥匙。
我估计有20个掠夺者/行走植物或者随便你怎么叫它们，还有10个那种吐口水的植物。他们可能很难找到，但他们找到你应该没有任何问题。如果你被困住了，就到处跑，你就会看到它们的，都杀了再来找我。
在田野的南端有一间旧的狩猎小屋，钥匙在门旁边的罐子里。为了表示诚意，你可以使用它，随便吃里面的东西。
- 布林德

ESP.ORIGINAL: Happy birthday me! 176 today! Mom and Dad would be proud.
ESP.TRADUIT: 祝我生日快乐！今天176岁了！爸爸妈妈会感到自豪的。

ESP.ORIGINAL:
28-94-CDX-UI-09
Damned if I can work out what this is the code to. Belonged to Grandpa who didn't know what it was for either.
But he did say he got it from his Grandpa and for some reason it seemed to amuse him. Old boy was probably senile, I should throw it away.
ESP.TRADUIT:
28-94-CDX-UI-09
该死的，我不知道这是什么密码。是爷爷的，他也不知道这是干什么用的。
但他说他是从他爷爷那里得到的，不知什么原因，这似乎让他很开心。老伙计可能已经老了，我应该扔掉他。

ESP.ORIGINAL:
57465890 Capt Kelly.M
Kelly, I want to make clear to you the priorities of this mission.
I've stuck my neck out for this, getting resources without getting noticed is a pain in the ass so make the most of it. Buy what and who you have to, but remember the coffers are not bottomless and keep as low profile as you can. As far as command is concerned this is just another recon mission and they don't need to know any different. And keep away from any Rangers, those boys have no business sense.
1. Confirm if this VaultTec vault information is true, I don't want to waste time chasing another goddamn tall story.
2. If you find it and its already been burned and looted, check it out but do not waste any more time on it than you have to. If we can cover our expenses that will do.
3. If its still sealed, find a way in and establish if there is anyone inside. I know that might not be easy, but you have shown aptitude in the past and I'm sure you won't let me down.
4. If its empty, catalogue the state of the facility and what is worth selling and keeping. If the place is serviceable, it may be worth selling to whoever offers the most, I've a contact that can deal with the details.
5. If its occupied then send in whatever scum you have hired to clear the place out. I don't want to be troubled be any vault dwellers looking for handouts. Once done revert to the above instruction.
6. Once the situation is finalised get rid of any of the hired crap that is left and pay off those troops that were in on the mission. I'll sort out the discharge papers for them. Make sure they know to keep their mouths shut.
We get this right and with a bit of luck we won't need our pathetic little NCR pensions. Don't get it wrong, our backer does not like fuck ups. It looks bad to voters.
Col F
ESP.TRADUIT:
57465890 凯利·M上尉
凯利，我想跟你说清楚这次任务的重点。
我为此冒了很大的风险，在不被注意的情况下获得资源是件很痛苦的事，所以好好利用吧。买你必须买的东西和人，但记住国库不是无底洞，尽可能保持低调。就指挥官而言，这只是另一次侦察任务，他们不需要知道有什么不同。离那些游骑兵远点，那些家伙没有商业头脑。
1. 确认一下这个避难所科技的信息是否属实，我不想再浪费时间去追另一个鬼故事了。
2. 如果你找到它的时候，它已经被烧毁和洗劫一空，那就搜查它，但不要浪费任何时间在不必要的事情上。只要我们能负担我们的开支，那就够了。
3.如果它仍然是密封的，想办法进去，看看里面是否有人。我知道这可能不容易，但你过去表现出了天赋，我相信你不会让我失望的。
4. 如果它是空的，列出设施的状况以及哪些设施值得出售和保留。如果这个地方还能用，可能值得卖给出价最高的人，我有个联系人可以处理细节问题。
5. 如果它有人居住，那就派任何你雇佣的人渣来清理这个地方。我不想被任何想要救济的避难所居民困扰。一旦完成，执行上述指令。
6. 一旦局势最终确定，清除所有被雇佣的垃圾，付钱给那些执行任务的部队。我会帮他们整理退伍文件的，一定要让他们守口如瓶。
如果我们做对了，运气好的话，就不需要可怜的NCR养老金了。别误会，我们的支持者不喜欢搞砸，这对选民来说很糟糕。
- 上校 F

ESP.ORIGINAL:
I was concerned when our initial recon party, or what was left of it, returned and reported another group in the area. It would appear they were also looking for the vault and quite organised. I thought this vault was meant to be undisclosed?
The survivor confirmed the Train Yards existence but that's it. Sometimes I feel I'm wasting my time with these idiots. Fortunately our other source is more reliable.
ESP.TRADUIT:
当我们最初的侦察队，或者它的残部，返回并报告该地区有另一群人时，我很担心。他们似乎也在找避难所，而且很有组织。我以为这个避难所是保密的?
幸存者证实了火车场的存在，但仅此而已。有时候我觉得跟这些白痴在一起是在浪费时间。幸运的是，我们的其他消息来源更可靠。

ESP.ORIGINAL: We have located the Train Yard and sent in another recon. We have lost more personnel than I anticipated on route to raiders, random snipers, etc. The last one was particularly nasty but now we can get on with the business in hand.
ESP.TRADUIT: 我们已经找到了火车场，派出了另一支侦察队。我们在通过掠夺者和随机狙击手的路上损失的人员比我预期的要多。最后一个特别讨厌，但现在我们可以继续处理手头的事情了。

ESP.ORIGINAL:
I've made this cave complex our HQ for the meantime as it suits our purpose quite well and we are not the first to use it, there was quite a lot of materials already here we could salvage.
I've held off moving into the train yard as our reconnaissance showed there were quite a few service tunnels around plus defences, robotic it would appear. Any way I don't want any damn robot popping out of the wall when I'm trying to manage this operation.
ESP.TRADUIT:
我把这个洞穴建筑群作为我们的总部，因为它很适合我们的目的，而且我们不是第一个使用它的人，这里已经有很多我们可以回收的材料。
我已经推迟了进入火车站场的时间，因为我们的侦察显示附近有很多军用隧道和防御设施，应该是机器人。无论如何，当我试图管理这项行动时，我不希望任何该死的机器人从墙里跳出来。

ESP.ORIGINAL:
We have found no trace of the other group our recon clashed with, other than some trash dumped in this cave as it would appear they also used it. There was some sort of diary entry as well but it didn't tell me anything I didn't already know. Pity.
On the plus side we have lost a few Vipers to the vault defences so the prognosis is good as it would indicate the vault is still intact.
ESP.TRADUIT:
我们没有发现与我们的侦察队发生冲突的另一群人的踪迹，除了一些倾倒在这个洞穴里的垃圾，看来这些垃圾是他们留下的。也有一些日记记录，但它没有告诉我任何我不知道的事，很遗憾。
从好的方面来说，因为避难所的防御我们已经失去了一些毒蛇帮，所以预测是对的，因为它表明，避难所仍然是完整的。

ESP.ORIGINAL:
It appears our sniper at the church has returned. He caused us some casualties on our way in and gave us the slip when we cleared the area, but now it seems he is back, the tenacious bastard.
I've held off killing him as we don't have the resources right now, I want to concentrate on locating the vault and time is pressing. Besides, with all the casualties we have taken on the way here, it might be worth trying to recruit him. I could use a man like that.
ESP.TRADUIT:
看来教堂的狙击手回来了。他在我们进来的路上造成了一些伤亡，我们清理了这片区域后又让我们溜走了，但现在看来他回来了，那个顽强的混蛋。
我没有杀他的时间，因为我们现在没有资源，我想集中精力找到避难所，时间紧迫。再说了，鉴于我们在来这里的路上伤亡惨重，招募他也许值得一试。我正需要这样一个人。

ESP.ORIGINAL: Curiously we have had a couple of people disappear. They have most likely become victim of some defence system but we can't locate the bodies. Granted they were only Vipers, so its not a major issue, but we do only have a limited supply of them.
ESP.TRADUIT: 奇怪的是，我们有几个人失踪了。他们很可能是某种防御系统的受害者，但我们找不到尸体。虽然他们只是些毒蛇帮，所以这不是大问题，但我们的供给确实有限。
追踪日志1/43：杰克 - 第0天
追踪日志2/43：丹尼尔 - 第1天

ESP.ORIGINAL:
I'm sitting this one out. There are too many unknowns and lets face it, our crew isn't exactly a squad of Rangers. JD runs a tight ship and can be ruthless, but I'm not sure even he can pull this off.
I mean, what's he got? Sure, Pinky's on board, but he isn't getting any younger and I suppose Spencer has been around a bit and is OK.
Linda is a decent medic, if you can keep her out of her own drugs long enough and then you got Finger and Suzy, a couple of wide eyed ex-raiders, also too fond of their chem's.
Max who isn't too bright, but he's bright enough to let JD do the thinking and big enough so people leave him alone and Spider can be useful as well. He can talk his way into anything, although that brings its own problems as it tends to be other men's women.
Bernie and Jack are good in a fight, but you should never confuse anger with courage and I wouldn't trust 'em as far as could comfortably spit them.
Bethany's clever, good with tech but she has issues, that girl seems to hate everyone. Then at the other end of the scale there is Jason who is as thick as molerat shit and a bit casual with other peoples property.
Finally you got the Cope brothers who are pretty solid I guess, just a bit intense. And of course Wellington, our pack Brahmin, probably the most reliable of the lot.
The skills are there, the problem is getting them to pull in the same direction and I doubt even a hard ass like JD can get that to work on a long expedition.
ESP.TRADUIT:
这次我不参加，有太多的未知数，让我们面对现实吧，我们的成员并不是一队游骑兵。JD做事很严格，有时也很无情，但我不确定他能不能成功。
我是说，他有什么?当然，平克加入了，但是他也不再年轻了，我想斯宾塞也已经在这一带生活了一段时间了，而且还不错。
琳达是个不错的医生，只要你能让她长时间远离自己的毒品，然后还有芬格和苏西，两个大眼睛的前掠夺者，也很喜欢他们的化学药物。
马克斯不是很聪明，但他觉悟够了，可以让JD去思考，也足够大，所以人们不会去管他，斯柏德也可以很有用。他可以用自己的方式说服任何事情，尽管这有其自身的问题，因为这往往是其他男人的女人。
伯尼和杰克在战斗中很厉害，但你永远不该把愤怒和勇气混为一谈，我也不会相信他们。
贝瑟妮很聪明，擅长科技。但她有问题，那女孩似乎讨厌所有人。然后在天平的另一端是杰森，他的脸皮厚得像一坨鼹鼠屎，对别人的财产有点随意。
最后是科普兄弟，我想他们很可靠，只是有点紧张。当然还有惠灵顿，我们的婆罗门，可能是最可靠的。
技巧是有的，问题是让他们朝着同一个方向前进，我怀疑即使是像JD这样的硬汉也不能让他们在长期的探险中工作。
追踪日志3/43：约瑟夫 - 第1天

ESP.ORIGINAL:
I detest it when people say we can't loose, its tempting fate.
The map seems genuine enough. Spider got it from a hobo in Westside for a bottle of rot gut, or so he says. This character said he knows the route well and even marked it for fellow hobo's somehow.
Normally I would just laugh, every wastelander has a treasure map but Pinky says he knows him. Said his name was Ezra, in his day a prospector and a good one too. Evidently he had some really big scores but then got a taste for Vegas and hence his new career path as a bum.
It can't be that simple though. Life just isn't like that.
ESP.TRADUIT:
我讨厌人们说我们不能失败，这是与命运赌博。
这张地图看起来很真实。斯柏德用一瓶劣酒从西区的一个流浪汉那里买的，至少他是这么说的。这个人说他很熟悉这条路，甚至还为流浪汉同伴做了一些标记。
通常我只会笑，每个废土人都有一张藏宝图，但平克说他认识这人，他说他叫以斯拉，在他那个年代是个淘金者，而且是个好淘金者。显然，他有过一些大的成绩，但后来尝到了拉斯维加斯的滋味，因而走上了流浪汉的新职业道路。
但事情没那么简单。生活并不是这样的。
追踪日志4/43：伯尼 - 第2天

ESP.ORIGINAL:
We're all in apart from Daniel. Says its fools gold. I think he has just gone soft in his old age, the old man would just slow us down anyway.
Keep your eye on Spider as well. He's been acting a little weird and I reckon he has an angle somewhere. I'm not worried as he's just a kid and if he pulls a fast one it will be his last, we just need to keep an eye on him, that's all.
ESP.TRADUIT:
除了丹尼尔，我们都同意，他说这是愚人金。我想他只是年纪大了变得软弱了，不管怎样，这个老头只会拖我们的后腿。
你也要盯紧斯柏德，他最近行为有点奇怪，我想他肯定有什么企图。我不担心，因为他还是个孩子，如果他耍了花招，这将是他的最后一次，我们只需要盯紧他，仅此而已。

ESP.ORIGINAL:
Jacks such an asshole. Does he honestly think we can just follow the map and take it all for ourselves? And set up a toll? Every fucker we come across will already be doing that. We are gonna have to fight and pay all the way to Zion.
But I've heard some good things about the place, unspoiled. And if the route is viable, well, that's information. And to people like the NCR and Crimson Caravan that's worth hard caps. Legion gold if it comes to that.
First stop is this place on the map called Hayford, I've heard there is a place to re-supply there.
ESP.TRADUIT:
杰克真是个混蛋。他真的认为我们可以按照地图把这一切都拿走吗?然后设置通行费?我们遇到的每个混蛋都已经在这么做了。我们要一路战斗到锡安。
但我听说过这个地方的好，如果没有被破坏，如果这条路线可行，这就是情报了。对于像NCR和深红商队这样的人来说，这是值得付钱的。如果真到了那个地步，我还可以拿军团的金币。
第一站是地图上一个叫海福德的地方，我听说那里有补给的地方。
追踪日志6/43：斯宾塞 - 第2天

ESP.ORIGINAL:
Spider sprung one on me today. Say's that hobo told him of a vault in the canyons. Says it still locked up tight. Came to me because I'm the vault expert and Bernie and Jack are dicks.
Makes sense I suppose, the entire population went underground during the war and there are vaults, shelters and holes everywhere.
Maybe I shouldn't mouthed off about vaults though. Sure I've been to Vault 34, didn't actually go in there, too much radiation. And I did go into Vault 22. Just. Well I looked inside. I thought the sign was just to put people off, but that place was too freaky.
I have been into Vault 19 to make a trade with some Powder Gangers, but I'll be damned if I was going to stick around to look about. Ironically, I then spent half of the caps in the only other vault I've been in, Vault 21. Not sure if that counts.
The hobo was probably just playing with the kid but then Spider does have a way with people. He's a silver tongued fucker, I've known him to get inside a women's pants in less than 10 minutes.
But a real deal un-opened Vault? They were meant to keep out nukes, how the hell are we going to get in? But what if we could? And who or what is inside?
ESP.TRADUIT:
斯柏德今天突然给了我一个消息。那个流浪汉告诉他峡谷里有个避难所，说它还锁得好好的。来找我是因为我是避难所专家而伯尼和杰克是两个混蛋。
我想这是有道理的，战争期间，所有人都转入地下，到处都是地窖、避难所和洞穴。
也许我不该对避难所吹毛求疵。我去过34号避难所，但没进去，辐射太猛了。我确实进入了22号避难所，但只是往里面看了看而已，我原以为那个标志是想让人们离开，但那个地方太诡异了。
我进过19号避难所，想和几个炸药帮做笔交易，但如果我还要留下来四处看看，那我就死定了。具有讽刺意味的是，我花了一半的瓶盖在另一个我去过的避难所，21号避难所。我不确定这算不算。
流浪汉可能只是在和孩子玩，但斯柏德确实很会和人打交道，他是个能说会道的混蛋，我知道他能在十分钟内把女人的裤子穿进去。
但是一个真正的未打开的避难所?它们是用来防止核武器的，我们要怎么进去?但如果我们可以呢?里面是谁或什么?
追踪日志7/43：杰森 - 第3天
追踪日志9/43：斯柏德 - 第3天

ESP.ORIGINAL:
Jesus, my head hurts. Not sure what the fuck hit me, I think it was one of those two asshole's, Jack or Bernie, probably Bernie. Didn't think they would actually try to kill me though.
I was just looking at that waterfall when the next thing I knew I was in the water trying not to drown. I managed to clamber onto a rock, I think they were still up there but I wasn't going to show myself or they would have finished me with a bullet. They soon went away as they probably thought I had drowned. Bernie thinks I can't swim cause I wouldn't go for a dip in Lake Mead when he did. I didn't bother telling him it was because of the Lakelurks.
Couldn't get back up the cliff to the others so I floated down steam until I found somewhere where I could pull myself out. There is a bridge up ahead, I'll get to there and work out what to do tomorrow, but I need rest first and sort out what kit I have. I've lost my rifle, but I think I can salvage my stealth boys.
ESP.TRADUIT:
天啊，我的头好疼。我不知道是什么东西打了我，我想是那两个混蛋中的一个，杰克或者伯尼，可能是伯尼。但我没想到他们真的会杀我。
我正看着那瀑布，然后我就知道自己在水里，努力不被淹死。我设法爬到一块岩石上，我想他们还在那里，但我不想露面，否则他们会用子弹打死我。他们很快就走了，因为他们可能以为我淹死了。伯尼认为我不会游泳，因为他去米德湖游泳，我却不去。我没告诉他是因为湖沼蟹的缘故。
无法回到悬崖上找其他人，所以我顺着水汽漂流直到我找到一个可以把自己拉出来的地方。前面有座桥，我会去那儿，然后想好明天要做什么，但我需要先休息一下，整理一下我的装备。我的步枪丢了，但我想我能找回我的隐身小子。
追踪日志10/43：苏西 - 第4天

ESP.ORIGINAL:
The fucking Spider thing blew up again this morning. It was gonna to happen.
After a lot of shouting and bullshit threats Jack and Bernie gave JD a mouthful and took off, said they knew a shorter route than the one we were following and would see us there, and get this; as long as we had the caps to pay their toll! Asshole's!
I thought for a moment JD was frag the pair of them, then Pinky said something to him and he just let them go. What the fuck is Pinky seeing that we're not? ah fuck it, I don't care and I seriously doubt we will be paying any fucking toll to Jack and Bernie.
ESP.TRADUIT:
该死的斯柏德事件今早又爆发了，这是一定会发生的。
在大喊大叫和胡言乱语的威胁之后，杰克和伯尼大骂JD然后离开了，说他们知道一条比我们走的更短的路线，会在那里看到我们，然后得到这些。只要我们有瓶盖给他们付过路费!这两个混蛋!
我一度以为JD要把他们俩撕碎了，然后平克对他说了些什么，他就放他们走了。平克知道了我们不知道的什么事?啊，操，我不在乎，我严重怀疑我们会给杰克和伯尼支付那该死的通行费。
追踪日志11/43：内森 - 第4天

ESP.ORIGINAL:
Spencer finally come clean about what Spider and him were up to.
They believed they knew the whereabouts of an unopened vault and were considering about taking it on themselves, but Spencer has come to his senses. Just as well as JD already seemed to know about it, or at least know that Spencer knew about it. The fools should know better to keep such information to themselves and besides, not much stays secret around here.
Seems Zion is postponed for the moment.
ESP.TRADUIT:
斯宾塞终于坦白了斯柏德和他的目的。
他们认为自己知道一个未开封的避难所的下落并考虑自己接手，但斯宾塞已经清醒过来了。就像JD似乎已经知道了，或者至少知道斯宾塞知道了一样。傻瓜们应该知道这些信息最好留给自己，而且，在这里没有什么是保密的。
锡安似乎暂时被推迟了。
追踪日志12/43：伯尼 - 第4天

ESP.ORIGINAL:
Fuck those losers, we'll get to Zion before them anyway. Jack reckons this route by-passes a whole load of shit. I can trust Jack, not those other fucker's.
I don't know why they were all whinging about Spider anyway. That was so funny, Jack is still laughing about it. He dared me to do him, so I did. Rifle butted him so hard he never made a sound, then just chucked his sorry ass over the cliff. I was aiming for the rocks, but I think he went into the water. Doesn't matter, the dick couldn't swim anyway.
As for the rest fuck 'em all. JD comes across all mean and nasty but I could take him down if I wanted, he don't frighten me. As for that smart ass Pinky he makes me want to puke. Thinks he knows everything, well, you didn't know about this route did you asshole.
ESP.TRADUIT:
去他妈的那些失败者，反正我们会比他们先到锡安。杰克认为这条路绕过了一大堆垃圾。我可以相信杰克，而不是那些混蛋。
我不知道他们为什么都在抱怨斯柏德。太有趣了，杰克至今还在笑，他激我打他，我就做了，步枪狠狠地撞在他身上，他没发出一点声音，然后就把他那可怜的屁股扔下了悬崖。我的目标是岩石，但我想他已经掉进水里了。无所谓了，反正这家伙也不会游泳。
至于其他的人，让他们都去死吧。JD是个卑鄙无耻的人，但如果我愿意，我可以把他打倒，他吓不倒我。至于那个自作聪明的平克，他让我想吐。以为他自己么都知道，好吧，但你不知道这条路线吧，傻逼。
追踪日志13/43：马克斯 - 第5天

ESP.ORIGINAL:
I'm surprised we got passed those raiders without a shot fired. It was a stroke of luck that Finger and Suzy knew one of them and organized passage and smart of JD to go through at dawn rather than the arranged time. By the time those doped up idiots had got themselves together we were already marching through and the look on that bitch in charge when JD thanked her for letting us through was priceless. There was fuck all she could do about us and she knew it, especially as JD was cradling 'Diplomacy' at the time. He dropped her some caps anyway. To oil the wheels and help her save face, in case we come back this way, he said.
I'm not saying they would have bushwhacked us as we went through but judging by all the crap lying around we wouldn't have been the first. Not sure if Finger or Suzy was in on it or not, JD sure 'kept them close.
ESP.TRADUIT:
我很惊讶我们没开一枪就通过了那些掠夺者。幸运的是，芬格尔和苏西认识他们中的一个，给我们安排了通行，JD聪明的决定在黎明通过，而不是原定的时间。当那些嗑药的白痴们清醒过来的时候，我们已经过去了，JD感谢那个管事的婊子让我们通过时，她脸上的表情是无价的。她对我们无能为力，她知道这一点，特别是当JD正在酝酿“外交”的时候。他还是付了一些瓶盖，“让事情顺利进行，帮她挽回点面子，万一我们从这里回来的话。”他说。
我不是说他们会在我们经过的时候偷袭我们，但从周围的垃圾来看我们不是第一个过去的。JD不确定芬格尔或苏西是否参与其中，但他肯定“和他们保持着密切的关系”。
追踪日志14/43：平克 - 第5天

ESP.ORIGINAL:
I thought Ezra had lost it when I saw him in Westside. But he managed to sell us a skanky old map, Spider a Vault and Jason a Treasure stash. You have to credit the old bastard, he's still got the touch when he's sober.
I wonder which of these are actually the real thing? I grilled him on it, as I did him some favours in the past.
I'll buy into the map, but he said to forget the vault. Why sell it to spider and then tell me that? The best lies always have a veneer of truth but he seemed strangely reluctant to go into details.
I seriously doubt we are the first he has sold this too as well.
ESP.TRADUIT:
当我在西区看到以斯拉时，我还以为他疯了。但他设法卖给我们一张肮脏的旧地图，斯柏德的避难所，杰森的宝藏。你得相信那个老混蛋，他清醒的时候还是有点本事的。
我想知道这些东西中哪些是真的?我问了他这个问题，因为我以前帮过他。
我买下了地图，但他让我忘了避难所吧。为什么把它卖给斯柏德，然后告诉我这个？最好的谎言总是有一层真实的外衣，但他似乎很奇怪地不愿意谈及细节。
我很怀疑我们是不是第一个买的。
追踪日志14/43：斯柏德 - 第5天
追踪日志16/43：杰克 - 第6天
追踪日志18/43：琳达 - 第6天

ESP.ORIGINAL:
I think I'm really losing it, I've used my last jet, and I have to get another fix.
I pulled sentry last night and I always hate that. Left me sat on a bar stool looking back the way we came, with one of the Cope's, Joseph I think, guarding the other way. Those two worry me. I'm no shrink, but they are far too tightly wrapped.
It was the early hours and I was singing to myself to keep awake. Fall asleep on sentry and JD would freak and he has a real nasty side to him. I always hear things in the dark anyway, but I swear I heard Spider calling to me. I'm not sure if I was asleep and dreaming or it was the drugs, or lack off, but I just ran back to the diner and kept watch from there.
Only Beth saw me. She gave me a nasty look but she won't mention it. She understands, she knows what I'm going through.
I shouldn't have come, I should have stayed with Daniel, I really feel strung out. I'll have a word with JD, we have stuff that will put me just right.
ESP.TRADUIT:
我觉得我真的要疯了，我已经用完最后一支杰特了，我必须再来一针。
我昨晚放哨了，我一直讨厌这样。让我坐在酒吧的凳子上，回头望着我们来的路，而科普家的一个人，我想是约瑟夫，守着另一条路。这两个人让我担心，我不是心理医生，但它们把自己包裹得太紧了。
当时是凌晨，我靠唱歌来保持清醒。如果在站岗的时候睡着了，JD会抓狂的，而且他有很讨厌的一面。反正我在黑暗中总能听到声音，但我发誓我听到斯柏德在叫我。我不确定我是睡着了，还是在做梦，还是因为嗑药，还是缺觉，但我只是跑回餐厅，从那里继续监视。
只有贝丝看见了我。她恶狠狠地看了我一眼，但她不会提这个。她理解，她知道我正在经历什么。
我不该来的，我应该和丹尼尔待在一起的，我真的觉得神经紧张。我会和JD谈谈，我们有能让我恢复正常的东西。
追踪日志19/43：斯柏德 - 第6天

ESP.ORIGINAL:
Lost Suzy today. Sniper got her. No one saw it coming and she certainly didn't. She was probably stoned again, wandering off down the road like that.
Joseph took down the Sniper as it didn't take him long to work out where he was, Joe's good like that. Not sure how the fucker got up there, Spencer wanted to go a loot the body but I told him to leave it, I don't want to waste time wandering around the mountains as there may be more of them and this is their turf.
It finished Finger, Suzy was the only real reason he was here. He just turned around and headed back, probably to those raiders at the bridge. I think he was still stewing about that incident, the fact I kept him in the dark about the move.
I let him go, I've had enough of Junkies today. Linda's becoming a problem again, although I'll stick with her because she's useful. Finger would become a liability.
ESP.TRADUIT:
今天失去了苏西，狙击手抓住了她。没有人预见到他的到来，她当然也没有。她可能又嗑药了，就那样在路上走来走去。
约瑟夫干掉了狙击手，因为他没花多少时间就知道了他在哪里，他在这方面很在行。不知道那混蛋是怎么到那里去的，斯宾塞想去搜刮尸体，但我告诉他别管了，我不想浪费时间在山上闲逛，因为那里可能有更多的人，这是他们的地盘。
这打垮了芬格尔，苏西是他来这里的唯一原因。他就转身往回走了，可能是去找桥头的掠夺者了。我想他还在为那件事耿耿于怀，因为我把行动的事瞒着他。
我放他走了，我今天受够瘾君子了。琳达又成了一个问题，不过我还是会带着她，因为她很有用。芬格尔会成为一个负担。
追踪日志21/43：杰森 - 第7天
追踪日志22/43：琳达 - 第7天

ESP.ORIGINAL:
We have lost another. Nathan was killed when we clashed with some Viper gang as we were looking for the Vault, the two groups practically walked into each other.
It was pretty bloody and one sided as I think only one of them escaped but Nathan just got unlucky, it was just a single stray round. No one is even sure who fired it.
Oh shit, I think it was me. It was all so chaotic and quick and I have this really horrible feeling it could have come from me accidentally. I don't know, nothings been said but there was nothing I could do for him, it was instant. The wound looks like a 10mm, that's what I carry.
Joseph took his body back to the church, says he needs to take care of him. Something about consecrated ground, a religious thing I think. No one tried to stop him.
I really need another fix.
ESP.TRADUIT:
我们又失去了一个成员。内森是在我们找避难所的时候和一些毒蛇帮发生冲突时被杀的，两帮人几乎是撞在一起了。
场面相当血腥，而且是一边倒的，我想他们只有一个人逃脱了，但内森就运气不太好，只是一发流弹而已，甚至没人知道是谁开的枪。
噢，该死，我想是我干的。这一切都是如此混乱和迅速，我有一种非常可怕的感觉，这可能是我无意中射出的。我不知道，没有人说什么，但我也无能为力，那是一瞬间的事。伤口看起来像10毫米口径的，我带的就是这个。
约瑟夫把他的尸体带回了教堂，说他需要照顾他，在神圣的土地，我想是某些宗教的东西。没有人试图阻止他。
我真的需要另一针。
追踪日志23/43：约瑟夫 - 第8天
追踪日志24/43：马克斯 - 第8天

ESP.ORIGINAL:
We have had a quick scout around, there is a lot here still locked up. Was going to try and get in but JD said to hold off. Not sure why, but you don't argue with JD.
Beth managed to hack into the only working terminal. Couldn't get much out of it but it seems the security systems are still online and there is an awful lot of it just for a fucking train yard. Guess JD was right.
I think the plan is too find a master terminal or a power source or something so we can shut the whole thing down.
ESP.TRADUIT:
我们在周围迅速检查了一下，这里还有很多东西是被锁着的。本来想进去，但JD说先别急。不知道为什么，但你不能和JD争论。
贝丝成功黑进了唯一能用的终端，没得到什么信息，但安保系统好像还在线，对于一个该死的火车场来说，安保系统够多的。看来JD是对的。
我想我们的计划是找到一个主终端或者电源什么的这样我们就能把整个系统关掉。

ESP.ORIGINAL:
Damn Pinky, he really pisses me off sometimes.
We found the Vault entrance! Vault 616. Still locked up tight. Result, now we just have to work out a way in. Yes that will be a tough one, a really tough one but the rewards could be huge. Then Pinky sticks his oar in.
He says leave it. Nothing good ever happened in a vault. Bad karma, conspiracy theory shit. Didn't give any specifics, rumour's, stuff he has heard, fucking etc, etc... And what did him mean about writing on the wall?
He's done this before.
And what sticks in my craw, what really fucking gets to me.... is that the old bastard is always right.
ESP.TRADUIT:
该死的平克，他有时候真让我生气。
我们找到避难所入口了!66号避难所，仍然锁得很紧。现在我们只需要想个办法进去。是的，这将是一个艰难的过程，一个非常艰难的任务，但回报可能是巨大的。然后平克把就自以为是的发表意见了。
他说别管了，避难所里从来没发生过好事。恶业，阴谋论，狗屁。没有给出任何细节，传闻，他听到的东西，他妈的等等...他在墙上写字是什么意思?
他以前也这么干过。
而让我受不了的是，真正让我不爽的是...那个老混蛋永远是对的。
追踪日志26/43：贝丝 - 第9天
追踪日志27/43：芬格尔 - 第10天

ESP.ORIGINAL:
I'm back where I belong.
I was surprised to see Ris in this shit hole though, last time I saw her was in Vault 3. Maybe she pissed off Motor-Runner once too often. Anyway, she says I'm cool so the others have accepted me as they don't fuck with Ris.
I had enough of those other asshole's anyway and JD never trusted me. Screw 'em.
ESP.TRADUIT:
我回到了属于我的地方。
我很惊讶在这鬼地方看到丽斯，我最后一次见到她是在3号避难所。也许她太频繁地惹怒"轰鸣恶煞"了。总之，她说我很好所以其他人都接受了我，因为他们不跟丽斯乱搞。
反正我也受够了其他混蛋了，JD一直不信任我，去他的吧。
追踪日志28/43：琳达 - 第10天

ESP.ORIGINAL:
We talked to Joseph on the way out and he is staying is staying at the church. Those two were always strange but loosing Nathan has pushed Joe over the edge, he has really lost it. He was quite aggressive with us.
Then again, maybe he knows.
ESP.TRADUIT:
我们离开的时候和约瑟夫聊了聊，他正呆在教堂里。那两个人总是很奇怪，但失去内森把约瑟夫逼到了崩溃的边缘，他真的失去理智了，他对我们很有攻击性。
话说回来，也许他知道。
追踪日志29/43：杰森 - 第10天
追踪日志30/43：斯宾塞 - 第11天
追踪日志31/43：斯宾塞 - 第12天
追踪日志33/43：琳达 - 第13天

ESP.ORIGINAL:
I'm still feeling rough, I've had a word with that trader to get me some stuff. He was a bit reluctant at first but I hit him with a load of medical jargon and won him around.
He was probably wondering why I didn't go to the Followers Doctor, but Louise would probably recognize me and I couldn't deal with that.
The others seem happy enough but I'm sure they are talking about me and the shooting back at the train yard. Deciding what to do.
ESP.TRADUIT:
我还是觉得不舒服，我和那个商人谈过了，让他给我买点东西。起初他有点不情愿，但我用一大堆医学术语说服了他。
他可能在想我为什么不去找天启追随者的医生，但露易丝可能会认出我，而我无法接受。
其他人似乎很高兴，但我肯定他们在谈论我和火车场里的枪击事件。决定该怎么做。
追踪日志34/43：贝丝 - 第14天
追踪日志35/43：平克 - 第15天
追踪日志36/43：马克斯 - 第15天
追踪日志38/43：马克斯 - 第16天
追踪日志39/43：平克 - 第16天
追踪日志40/43：平克 - 第17天
追踪日志41/43：平克 - 第18天
追踪日志42/43：贝丝 - 第20天

ESP.ORIGINAL:
Pinky is still sleeping. The poor old bastard was all in, probably from dragging my sorry ass around.
My head is pounding and ears are still ringing a bit but we are safe now. Those tribal's following us tried to get in as well but its not a mistake they will make again. I hope those robots are programmed to clear up the mess.
When I saw it, it was almost too much to hope for but there it was. We found Stone Case. My habit of collecting old computer files and passwords has often paid dividends but never before on this scale. This time it really was a life saver and we have literally struck gold to boot.
It is a pity we cannot share it with JD and Max, and Linda but if they were still alive we would probably would never have ended up here in the first place. I wonder what happened to the others?
Fate has been whimsical this journey.
ESP.TRADUIT:
平克还在睡觉。那个可怜的老混蛋全力以赴，可能是因为拖着我这个可怜的屁股到处跑。
我的头在砰砰作响，耳朵也在嗡嗡作响，但我们现在安全了。那些跟着我们的部落也试图进入但他们不会再犯这个错误了。我希望那些机器人的程序是用来清理混乱的。
当我看到它的时候，我几乎不敢奢望，但它确实存在，我们找到了斯通计划。我收集旧电脑文件和密码的习惯经常给我带来好处，但从未有过这么大的回报。这一次它真的救了我们的命，我们真的挖到了金矿。
很遗憾我们不能和JD、马克斯和琳达一起分享，但是如果他们还活着，我们可能根本不会来到这里。我想知道其他人怎么样了?
这段旅程的命运变幻莫测。

ESP.ORIGINAL:
To Whom it may concern
Sorry, we beat you to it. We have already taken most of what was in here and we have left this one gold bar as we couldn't carry any more. We considered coming back for it so we reset the security systems as you will have noticed.
But, if you have made it this far you probably deserve this and we won't hold it against you for taking whatever's left.
Enjoy - Beth & Pinky
ESP.TRADUIT:
致有关人士
对不起，我们抢先了一步。我们已经拿走了这里大部分的东西，只剩下这一根金条，因为我们再也拿不动了。我们考虑过回来取，所以我们重新设置了安全系统，你们应该也注意到了。
但是，如果你能走到这一步，这可能是你应得的，我们不会因为你拿走了剩下的东西而责怪你。
享受吧 - 贝丝和平克

ESP.ORIGINAL:
March, 2078. We're here. Hoping to find food and supplies in this supply bunker we are here to empty. Maybe shelter as well, I'm sick of rad meds and my respirator is starting to pull the skin of my face. There are still radiation clouds everywhere but at least the black rain hasn't returned.
The captain isn't helping though, he has become a real martinet. He has already shot one man for insubordination and desertion is starting to become more common.
ESP.TRADUIT:
2078年3月。我们在这里，希望在这个我们要清空的补给掩体里找到食物和补给品，也许还有避难所，我已经厌倦了辐射药物，我的呼吸器开始扯破我的皮肤。到处都有辐射云，但至少黑雨还没有来。
不过上尉也没帮上忙，他已经变成了一个真正严格执行纪律的人。他已经以不服从命令为由枪毙了一个人，逃兵也开始变得越来越普遍。

ESP.ORIGINAL:
We have hit problem as we can't get in, sounds like we don't have the access codes for some reason. The captain in desperation just decided to blast his way in the first entrance he came to and only managed to bring down the tunnel. Now we are seriously fucked. We located a service entrance, tried the same thing and almost achieved the same results. Now we can't force that either without collapsing it. It would be funny, but he is now panicking and taking it out on us.
He finally listened to one of the sappers who suggested we could dig our way in. We have blasted as much as we dare and are now going at it with whatever tools we have, but the guys are really keen as there maybe some decent food and shelter for us at the end of it.
ESP.TRADUIT:
我们遇到麻烦了，因为我们进不去，听起来好像因为某种原因我们没有密码。在绝望中，上尉决定从他来到的第一个入口炸开一条路，结果只成功地把隧道炸塌了，现在我们真的完蛋了。我们找到了一个服务入口，尝试了同样的方法，几乎得到了同样的结果。现在我们也无法在不破坏它的情况下强行打开它。这很有趣，但他现在很慌张，把气撒在我们身上。
最后他听从了一个工兵的建议，我们可以挖一条路进去。我们已经尽了最大的努力，现在我们正在用我们所拥有的一切工具进行挖掘，但这些人真的很热心，因为最后可能会有一些体面的食物和住所。

ESP.ORIGINAL:
Well, we made it, but its not all we hoped for. The vault was obviously subject to some cutbacks. Its letting in water, the air is fetid and the reactor is leaking.
There are supplies here, but the captain has managed to bring a train up and is shipping the stuff straight out. I'm sure him and his little inner circle are helping themselves to it, but most of us are getting nothing. The rest of us are exhausted as we are having to hump everything by hand through the hole we dug to get in.
ESP.TRADUIT:
嗯，我们成功了，但这并不是我们所希望的。避难所显然受到了一些影响，灌满了水，空气恶臭，反应堆正在泄漏。
这里有补给，但上尉设法调来了一列火车把东西直接运出去了。我相信他和他的小圈子是在帮自己，但我们大多数人什么都得不到。我们其他人都累坏了，因为我们必须用手把所有的东西从我们挖的洞里送出去。

ESP.ORIGINAL: I've found this working terminal but there are no records, I guess the main server is dead. I told the Captain I'm still working on recovering data but I'm just using it to type up my diary. It beats humping stores around and I don't trust myself to leave the food alone. I am so hungry.
ESP.TRADUIT: 我找到了这个可以工作的终端，但是没有记录，我猜主服务器已经死了。我告诉上尉我还在恢复数据，但我只是用它来打我的日记。这比搬运仓库强多了，我都不相信自己会放下食物不管。我好饿。

ESP.ORIGINAL: One of the train carriages broke down. Its been repaired by scavenging parts from the rearmost carriage which is being abandoned. We are taking the remaining supplies by road in what vehicles we have. Two guys from the 2nd company took some of the food as they were shifting it, then the captain found out and had them shot out of hand.
ESP.TRADUIT: 火车的一节车厢坏了，最后是通过从最后面的被遗弃的车厢上卸下部件来修复的。我们正在用我们所拥有的车辆通过公路运送剩余的物资，二连的两个人在转移食物的时候拿走了一些，后来被上尉发现了，他们被枪毙了。

ESP.ORIGINAL:
We have finally got to Ground House and it is not good. The whole thing looks like its collapsed. More specifically it looks like the place has been blown up, god knows why.
So what now? we are sheltering in the tunnel, it still seems to be solid enough around the entrance. At least we have water here and there enough wildlife around here to hunt.
Some of the group want to head south to Vegas, but I'm not buying it. I think we should stay away from any large centers of population.
ESP.TRADUIT:
我们终于找到了地上小屋，情况不妙，整个房子看起来都塌了。更确切地说，这地方好像被炸毁了，天知道为什么。
那么现在呢?我们躲在隧道里，入口周围似乎还很坚固。至少我们在这里有水，周围有足够的野生动物可以捕猎。
有些人想往南去维加斯，但我不这么想。我认为我们应该远离人口密集的地方。

ESP.ORIGINAL:
Some people have headed south while the rest of us are still hanging on here, its not been easy but we are surviving. We have had help from some outsiders joining us, the stories they have been sharing do not paint a nice picture of the world.
We still haven't given up on the storage vault, we cleared some of the rubble away from a building on top of the tunnel to find an entrance and we managed to break into what I think is part of the tunnel maintenance system. Typically they lead to the same place. We came to stop at a security door, it looks like someone has been here before us and tried to blow it which has ruled out that option for us. The whole thing could come down. Still, at least we don't actually need it now. We are surviving without it.
ESP.TRADUIT:
有些人已经往南走了，而我们其他人还在这里坚持，这并不容易，但我们活下来了。我们得到了一些外来者的帮助，他们分享的故事并没有描绘出一幅美好的世界。
我们还没有放弃避难所，我们清理了隧道顶部一座建筑的一些碎石，以便找到一个入口，我认为我们设法闯入了隧道维护系统的一部分，通常它们都指向同一个地方。我们在一个安全门前停了下来，看起来有人比我们先到过这里并试图炸毁它，这就排除了我们的这个选择，整个都可能被炸毁了。不过，至少我们现在实际上并不需要它，没有它，我们也能生存。

ESP.ORIGINAL: Heard from Charlie, he tried Vegas but I don't think it was much good and it sounds like he has settled at a place further south of here. Good to hear from the old buzzard.
ESP.TRADUIT: 查理的消息，他成功到维加斯了，但我觉得不怎么样，听起来他好像在更南边的地方定居了。很高兴听到这个老秃鹰的消息。

ESP.ORIGINAL:
My wife has been nagging me to stay out of that tunnel again. I think everyone has forgotten why we originally came here but I've never lost my curiosity about that storage vault, what was it called? Ground House?
I managed to pull out some wiring at that security door and have been trying to hook up a computer to it. There is still some sort of network there I think, but I'll be damned if I can hack into it. I'm sure we brought the access code with us, was it David that had it? He never came back from Vegas.
My son sits and watches me, maybe he will have better luck some day. Truth be known we still don't know if there is anything behind that door. Maybe my wife is right, I should give it up, I'm too old for this now.
ESP.TRADUIT:
我妻子一直在唠叨，让我不要再去那个隧道。我想每个人都忘记了我们最初来这里的原因，但我从未失去对那个储存库的好奇心，它叫什么？地上小屋？
我设法拉出了安全门上的一些线路，试图把一台电脑连接到上面。我认为那里仍然有某种网络，但如果我能黑进去，那就见鬼了。我肯定我们带了密码，是大卫拿着吗？他再也没从维加斯回来。
我的儿子坐在那里看着我，也许有一天他会有更好的运气。说实话我们还不知道那扇门后面是否有东西，也许我妻子是对的，我应该放弃，我现在太老了。

ESP.ORIGINAL:
Vault 616 was due to open this year, but nothing has been seen. Every now and then we get a story of folks disappearing around the train yard, but we stay away. It's kind of achieved bogey man status now. Locals here know but no one says anything. Its as if you don't speak of it, its not real.
Someday the outside world will find it, then there will be a reckoning.
ESP.TRADUIT:
66号避难所原定于今年开放，但目前还没有任何动静。我们时不时会听到有人在火车场边失踪的故事，但我们都远离了，现在已经算是恐怖故事了，当地人知道，但没人说什么。如如果你不谈论它，它就不是真的。
总有一天外面的世界会发现它，然后就会跟它算总账的。

ESP.ORIGINAL:
Do not activate this robot. Its behaving very strangely.
Scheduled for serving as soon as there is a pad available.
Security
ESP.TRADUIT:
不要激活这个机器人。它的行为非常奇怪。
预定服务，只要有一个pad可用。
- 安保

ESP.ORIGINAL: Trail Log 32 of 43: Jason Corpse Note
ESP.TRADUIT: 追踪日志32/43：杰森尸体笔记

ESP.ORIGINAL:
You Idiot Alan, I told you not to take too much. I liked that kid, he was one of my favourite blood groups and we could have strung him out for ages.
Anyway, see if you can find the kids name, it was Jason I think, you know the Chef likes to give his dishes a name but tell him no curry this time. I want to be able to taste this one 'cause 'Melvin Madras' burnt my ass off. And see if there is any Chianti left.
ESP.TRADUIT:
你这个白痴艾伦，我告诉过你不要吃太多。我喜欢那孩子，他是我最喜欢的血型之一我们可以把他挂起来很长时间。
总之，看看你能不能找到那孩子的名字，我想是杰森，你知道厨师喜欢给他的菜起名字，但这次告诉他不要咖喱。我想尝尝这个，因为梅尔文·马德拉斯被我烤焦了。看看还有没有基安蒂干红葡萄酒。

ESP.ORIGINAL:
Hey Blinder you idiot
Do you remember the name 'Burgess'. Didn't you get that name out of one of those clowns who then disappeared down that tunnel of yours a few years back. Well guess who has turned up and camped out in the old house at the top of Hayford. A Ghoul, nasty piece of work and asking a lot of questions.
ESP.TRADUIT:
嘿，布兰德，你这个白痴
你还记得伯吉斯这个名字吗？这名字不是几年前从你那条隧道里消失的小丑那里听来的吗。猜猜谁出现了，在海福德顶上的老房子里露宿了。一个食尸鬼，讨厌的家伙，还问了很多问题。

ESP.ORIGINAL:
Yeah I remember.
Well don't just sit there with your thumb up your ass, find out what his game is. Give his drum a spin if you have to, but don't use Emma, she's a good girl. Find a passing wastelander, preferably one with an IQ at least into double figures (which of course rules you out).
ESP.TRADUIT:
是的，我记得。
好了别傻坐着，看看他在玩什么把戏。如果有必要，可以试探一下他，但别用艾玛，她是个好女孩。找一个路过的废土客，最好是智商至少达到两位数的人(这当然会把你排除在外)。).

ESP.ORIGINAL:
Of course I won't use Emma you cretin. And keep your eye out for a group of mercs under NCR command. Not sure what they are up to, but they are bad news.
And have you sorted out your Lurk farm yet or are they still getting eaten by the fruit plants! That's so funny, but if you do get it sorted send some of the Lurk meat down with Angel
ESP.TRADUIT:
我当然不会用艾玛，你个白痴。留意一群在NCR指挥下的雇佣兵，不知道他们在做什么，但肯定是坏事。
你已经整理好你的沼蟹农场了吗？还是它们还在被水果植物吃掉!真有趣，但如果你把它解决了，就送一些沼蟹肉给安琪儿去。

ESP.ORIGINAL:
Hey Fuckstick,
I've got some news on Burgess. I got this ugly looking prospector to go through his place. It seems he is interested in Ground House and I reckon this prospector has some more info on it. I've gave your name and told them to look you up. Be careful, this one has an arsenal and isn't shy about using it.
oh and that NCR outfit, seems they are looking for freak central. That's going to get messy.
ESP.TRADUIT:
嘿，操你妈的，
我有关于伯吉斯的消息。我找了个长得很丑的淘金客去他家，他似乎对地上小屋很感兴趣，我估计这个淘金客还有更多的信息。我把你的名字告诉他们了，让他们去找你。小心，这个人有一个军火库，而且毫不吝啬地使用它。
哦，还有那个NCR的小队，看起来他们在找怪胎中心。那就麻烦了。

ESP.ORIGINAL:
Need to finish that ammo consignment, Angel is bound to be back through sometime soon and will be expecting it.
I'll get on to Emma about it, that daughter of mine needs to pull her head out of the clouds and get some work done, too dreamy and idealistic, just like her mother. But that's the Poke family for you.
ESP.TRADUIT:
要完成那批弹药的运送，安琪儿一定会很快回来，并期待它的到来。
我会去找艾玛的，我的女儿需要振作起来，完成一些工作，她太爱幻想，太理想化了，就像她妈妈一样。但这就是你的波克家族。

ESP.ORIGINAL: A group of mercs come prospectors turned up today. We did some trading and they crashed at the hotel overnight, I think they are heading to Zion for some reason although they were pretty tight lipped about it. From what I gather there has been some falling out within the group as well, maybe there are some more of them around, I'll keep my eye out.
ESP.TRADUIT: 今天来了一群雇佣兵和淘金客。我们做了一些生意，他们在酒店过夜，我认为他们由于某种原因正前往锡安，尽管他们对此讳莫如深。据我所知，这群人内部也有一些争执，也许他们还有一些人在附近，我会继续留意的。

ESP.ORIGINAL:
Another big group came in today. Not sure what their story is, seems to be an NCR operation but most of the foot soldiers were Vipers or some other gang. They haven't been too much trouble, other than the usual, but it's a strange combination. They were not too subtle about Ris and her toll bridge either, I think she just legged it after a brief fire fight. That may cause problems later on if and when she returns.
Didn't like the look of this group though, may have to send word and warn that idiot brother-in-law of mine.
ESP.TRADUIT:
今天又来了一大群人。不确定他们的故事是什么，似乎是NCR的行动，但大部分步兵是毒蛇帮或其他帮派的人。除了通常的情况，他们并没有带来太多麻烦，但这是一个奇怪的组合。他们对丽斯和她的收费桥也没有太多微词，我想她只是在短暂的交火后跑了。如果她回来的话，这可能会引起一些问题。
不过我不喜欢这群人的样子，可能得给我那个白痴妹夫捎个信。

ESP.ORIGINAL:
I need to get to the bottom of this guys story. He has been here about a month now, but he is not the settling down type of person.
He is a mean and nasty piece of work, which has been useful dealing with our local raider problems, but he has been snooping around everywhere and asking an awful lot of questions.
He has an angle somewhere and I need to find out what it is.
ESP.TRADUIT:
我得搞清楚这家伙的底细。他到这里已经一个月了，但他不是那种喜欢安定下来的人。
他是个卑鄙下流的家伙，在处理我们当地的掠夺者问题上很有用，但他一直在到处窥探，问了一大堆问题。
他肯定有什么企图，我得查出是什么。

ESP.ORIGINAL:
I don't believe that weirdo Frobisher disappeared with some hooker the other day. I didn't think he had it in him.
He is a freaky guy but has been a really good customer for junk. He must have a place up the river somewhere, north of here I'm guessing.
ESP.TRADUIT:
我不相信那个怪人弗罗比舍。那天和某个妓女一起消失了，没想到他还有这个本事。
他是个古怪的家伙，但一直是垃圾的好顾客。肯定在河上游的某个地方有个住处，我猜是在北边。

ESP.ORIGINAL:
Chief
I've 'confined' Dr Nice to his office, it didn't seem right to put in one of the cages as we have done with the others in the past.
We may be able to do something in the future for him but these compounds we are dealing with are just so complex.
We can only carry on with his work and hope we find a solution, but since he was the mind behind all this, his condition is a real setback for us. Dr Nice thought he had this under control but we must of missed something. We will do what we can.
Senior research Tech PP Dr Nice
ESP.TRADUIT:
长官
我把尼斯博士“限制”在他的办公室里了，把他关在其中一个笼子里似乎不合适，因为我们过去对其他人做过。
也许将来我们可以为他做点什么，但是我们现在处理的这些化合物太复杂了。
我们只能继续他的工作，希望我们能找到解决办法，但由于他是这一切的幕后主使，他的情况对我们来说是一个真正的挫折。尼斯博士以为他已经控制住了病情，但我们肯定漏掉了什么。我们将尽我们所能。
高级研究技术员 尼斯博士定向通信

ESP.ORIGINAL:
We have had enough. They were making some of the guys move the barrels of radioactive waste outside into the collapsed chamber. We rounded the captain and all his cronies up and locked them all in the reactor room, so they can see what it feels like.
They will get out soon enough but the radiation will kill them before long and even if it doesn't we are going to bring the rest of this tunnel down to seal them in.
We have eaten what we wanted and are taking the remaining supplies for ourselves. We are going to head back to try and find our families. Screw the military, screw the government. There is nothing left to fight for, no country left to serve. Its all gone to hell and they sent it there.
ESP.TRADUIT:
我们受够了。他们让一些人把装满放射性废料的桶搬到外面坍塌的房间里，我们把上尉和他的亲信都抓了起来把他们都锁在反应堆室里，让他们尝尝这滋味。
他们很快就会出来，但辐射很快就会杀死他们，即使不能，我们也要把隧道的其余部分封死。
我们已经吃完了想吃的东西，把剩下的食物都据为己有。我们要回去找我们的家人，去他妈的军队，去他妈的政府。没有什么值得战斗的了，没有什么国家值得服务了。一切都完蛋了，是他们造成的。

ESP.ORIGINAL:
Chief
Thank you for your concern regarding the UV lighting used to maintain the flora. I am well aware of the harmful effects photophobia can have on our residents but you must understand that these plants form an important function in our air filtration system and if we switch the lights off permanently they will die.
We can shut the atrium off for periods when the lights are on and suitable eye protection can be worn by anyone who has to go in there. You already have the modified issue security helmets used for external patrols & snatch squads.
Senior research Tech PP Dr Nice
PS If you handle the current 'visitors' correctly we will have enough livestock so we won't have to venture outside, for a while at least.
ESP.TRADUIT:
长官
感谢您对维持植物群用的紫外线照明的关注。我很清楚畏光症会对我们的居民产生有害影响，但你必须明白，这些植物在我们的空气过滤系统中起着重要的作用，如果我们永久关灯，它们就会死亡。
我们可以在灯亮着的时候将中庭关闭一段时间，任何必须进入中庭的人都可以戴上合适的护目镜。你们已经有了用于外部巡逻和回收小队的改良型安全头盔。
高级研究技术员 尼斯博士定向通信
另外，如果你能正确处理目前的“访客”，我们将有足够的牲畜，这样我们就不用冒险出门了，至少在一段时间内。

ESP.ORIGINAL: Geoff, I've told you before, I will not generate a timesheet code for robot servicing, its not needed.
ESP.TRADUIT: 杰夫，我之前告诉过你，我不会为机器人服务生成时间表代码，这是不需要的。

ESP.ORIGINAL:
Geoff, stop moaning and get on with it. I see your timesheets every week and I know you have not spent more time on robot servicing than you have on rail maintenance work. They are not a waste of time as our projections indicate they will increase efficiency by 34.7%.
And stop picking on Des. And stop hiding his lucky Dino toy, I really don't have time for this nonsense.
ESP.TRADUIT:
杰夫，别抱怨了，快干活。我每周都会看你们的时间表，我知道你们在机器人维修上花的时间并不比在铁路维修上花的时间多。做这些不是浪费时间，因为我们的预测表明它们将提高34.7%的效率。
别再找德斯的茬了，别再藏他的幸运恐龙玩具了，我真的没时间听这些废话。

ESP.ORIGINAL:
Current Timesheet status
Baxter, Marcus - 999+ weeks late Davies, Michael - 999+ weeks late Evans, Albert - 999+ weeks late Green, Robert - 999+ weeks late Muller, Karl - 999+ weeks late Smith, Geoffrey - Up to date Tate, Nicholas - 999+ weeks late
ESP.TRADUIT:
当前时间表状态
马库斯·巴克斯特 - 迟到999周以上
迈克尔·戴维斯 - 迟到999周以上
阿尔伯特·埃文斯 - 迟到999周以上
罗伯特·格林 - 迟到999周以上
卡尔·穆勒 - 迟到999周以上
杰弗里·史密斯 - 至今
尼古拉斯·泰特 - 迟到999周以上
追踪日志37/43：贝丝 - 第15天

ESP.ORIGINAL:
Cracked it! Stone Case, Access code: DH65-HJ2976. Almost there with the security code.
I think its a pre-war facility of sorts, but there's only a place name which I don't recognise. There's no coordinate data.
ESP.TRADUIT:
破解了！斯通计划，接入码:DH65-HJ2976。安全密码快弄好了。
我想这是一个战前的设施，但只有一个地名我不认识。没有坐标数据。

ESP.ORIGINAL: RobcOS v.85 (C)2076 Robco ======================== | User Log: | >> Administrator (RobcoID 2902-C) | >> Default Targeting_Param: | >>> Goverment_userGroup | >>> Contract Ref: 'Stone Case' ========================
Hello, Can I help you with something?
ESP.TRADUIT: 您好，有什么可以帮您的吗？

ESP.ORIGINAL: You're not one of my regulars, what do want?
ESP.TRADUIT: 你不是我的常客，你想要什么？

ESP.TRADUIT: 我现在真的很忙，对不起。

ESP.TRADUIT: 这是铁路资产，根据健康和安全条例你需要一个有效的工作许可证才能继续。

ESP.TRADUIT: 欢迎光临丽塔咖啡馆，请尽情放松，随便看看。

ESP.ORIGINAL: Break any of our law's and we'll kill you. You have a nice day now.
ESP.TRADUIT: 违反我们的任何法律，我们都会杀了你。祝你今天过得愉快。

ESP.TRADUIT: 我得回去工作了，在旅馆找我吧。

ESP.ORIGINAL: Did you like our burglar alarm? Smarts don't it?
ESP.TRADUIT: 你喜欢我们的防盗报警器吗？是不是很聪明？

[NCR] Relax trooper we are on the same side, how you doing?
ESP.TRADUIT: [NCR] 放轻松，我们站在同一边，你好吗？

ESP.ORIGINAL: This is the worst detail in the Mojave
ESP.TRADUIT: 这是莫哈韦地区最糟糕的细节。
ESP.COMMENTAIRE: NPC : Private Dodds [0500A178] (mod) Quest : ([05019F66]ZkbPvtDodds01Quest) Pvt Dodds Dialog EmotionType : Sad NPC : Private Dodds [0500A178] (mod) Quest : ([05019F66]ZkbPvtDodds01Quest) Pvt Dodds Dialog EmotionType : Sad Audio : \Sound\Voice\ZionTrail.esm\MaleAdult05\ZkbPvtDodd_ZkbDoddsTalk50_0001AD18_1.ogg

ESP.ORIGINAL: You got to piss some one off to pull guard duty out here
ESP.TRADUIT: 你得惹怒谁才能在这里站岗？
ESP.COMMENTAIRE: NPC : Private Dodds [0500A178] (mod) Quest : ([05019F66]ZkbPvtDodds01Quest) Pvt Dodds Dialog EmotionType : Sad NPC : Private Dodds [0500A178] (mod) Quest : ([05019F66]ZkbPvtDodds01Quest) Pvt Dodds Dialog EmotionType : Sad Audio : \Sound\Voice\ZionTrail.esm\MaleAdult05\ZkbPvtDodd_ZkbDoddsTalk50_0001AD18_2.ogg

ESP.ORIGINAL: So what's the other side of that gate?
Well, that's the way I'm going
ESP.TRADUIT: 好吧，那就是我要走的路。

ESP.COMMENTAIRE: NPC : Private Dodds [0500A178] (mod) Quest : ([05019F66]ZkbPvtDodds01Quest) Pvt Dodds Dialog EmotionType : Neutral NPC : Private Dodds [0500A178] (mod) Quest : ([05019F66]ZkbPvtDodds01Quest) Pvt Dodds Dialog EmotionType : Neutral Audio : \Sound\Voice\ZionTrail.esm\MaleAdult05\ZkbPvtDodd_ZkbDoddsTalk52_0001AD1A_1.ogg

[Terrifying Presence] Where ever I want, now make me happy and say 'over my dead body'
ESP.TRADUIT: [可怕的存在]我想去哪里就去哪里，现在让我高兴，说“除非我死了”。

ESP.COMMENTAIRE: NPC : Private Dodds [0500A178] (mod) Quest : ([05019F66]ZkbPvtDodds01Quest) Pvt Dodds Dialog EmotionType : Fear NPC : Private Dodds [0500A178] (mod) Quest : ([05019F66]ZkbPvtDodds01Quest) Pvt Dodds Dialog EmotionType : Fear Audio : \Sound\Voice\ZionTrail.esm\MaleAdult05\ZkbPvtDodd_ZkbDoddsTalk60_0001AD1B_1.ogg
